This article lists the soundtracks attributed to the ''[[Death Note]]'' franchise. {{Refimprove|date=August 2010}} ==Film soundtracks== ===''Sound of Death Note''=== {{Infobox album | | Name = Sound of Death Note | Type = Soundtrack | Artist = [[Kenji Kawai]] | Background = | Released = 17 June 2006 | Recorded = | Genre = [[Film soundtrack]] | Length = | Label = [[Video and Audio Project|VAP]] | Producer = | Reviews = | Chart position = | Last album = | This album = | Next album = }} '''''Sound of Death Note''''' is a soundtrack featuring music from the first ''Death Note'' film composed and arranged by [[Kenji Kawai]]. It was released on 17 June 2006 by [[Video and Audio Project|VAP]] and is priced at [[Japanese yen|Â¥]]2500. It is also available if you have the Death Note DVD in the original Japanese version. ====Track listing==== #"A Heart attack" #" A Love Sickness #"A Dispute" #"Confused" #"Realize the Limitations" #"Disturbance" #"â¦In the Heart" #"Astonishment" #"A Reality" #"Logic" #"A Challenge" #"Make a Noise in The World" #"A Shadow" #"The Test" #"Give the Right Answer" #"Reasoning Powers" #"Carry Out a Plan" #"Memo Paper" #"Be Cute" #"Impatience" #"An Image" #"Suspicion" #"Misunderstand" #"According to Plan" #"A Sacrifice" #"An Observer" #"Go Into Battle" #"Believe in Yourself" ===''Sound of Death Note the Last name''=== {{Infobox album | | Name = Sound of Death Note the Last name | Type = Soundtrack | Artist = [[Kenji Kawai]] | Background = | Released = 2 November 2006 | Recorded = | Genre = [[Film soundtrack]] | Length = | Label = [[Video and Audio Project|VAP]] | Producer = | Reviews = | Chart position = | Last album = | This album = | Next album = }} '''''Sound of Death Note the Last name''''' is a soundtrack featuring music from the second ''Death Note'' film, ''Death Note the Last name'', composed and arranged by [[Kenji Kawai]]. It was released on 2 November 2006 by [[Video and Audio Project|VAP]] and is priced at [[Japanese yen|Â¥]]2500. ====Track listing==== #"yellow eyes" #"sympathy" #"draw near" #"a temptation" #"eveningspot" #"sakura terebi matsuri ondo"lit. "sakura tv festival marching song" #"videotape message" #"burn with anger" #"stranger" #"a light shining in the darkness" #"warning" #"dear" #"imprisonment" #"weak point" #"make a program" #"parental love" #"tickle a person's vanity" #"trick" #"desire for revenge" #"investigate" #"narcissism" #"set a trap" #"be caught in a trap" #"advent" #"feint" #"an innocent virgin" #"decoy" #"fear" #"loser" #"game over" #"sad man" #"the dignity of man" #"pure love" #"the last name" ==Anime soundtracks== ===''Death Note Original Soundtrack''=== {{Infobox album | | Name = Death Note Original Soundtrack | Type = Soundtrack | Artist = [[Yoshihisa Hirano]]
[[Hideki Taniuchi]] | Background = | Released = December 21, 2006 | Recorded = | Genre = [[Anime soundtrack]] | Length = 1 hour, 13 minutes | Label = [[Video and Audio Project|VAP]] | Producer = [[Kazunari Sengoku]]
Makoto Saito
[[Tokuwa Nagae]] | Reviews = | Chart position = | Last album = | This album = | Next album = }} The '''''Death Note Original Soundtrack''''' for the [[anime]] adaptation was first released in Japan on December 21, 2006 and was published by [[Video and Audio Project|VAP]]. It contains music from the series, composed by [[Yoshihisa Hirano]] and [[Hideki Taniuchi]], with the first opening and ending themes sung by the Japanese band [[Nightmare (Japanese band)|Nightmare]] in the TV size format.{{Cite magazine |title=Music Picks |work=Newtype USA |volume=6 |issue=4 |page=p. 116 |month=April |year=2007 |issn=1541-4817 }} The first press' slipcover featured glow-in-the-dark artwork. ====Track listing==== #"Death Note" #{{Nihongo|"Incident"|äºä»¶|Jiken}} #{{Nihongo|"Light's Theme"|ã©ã¤ãã®ãã¼ã|Raito no TÄma}} #{{Nihongo|"L's Theme"|Lã®ãã¼ã|Eru no TÄma}} #{{Nihongo|"Tension"|ç·å¼µ|KinchÅ}} #{{Nihongo|"Horror"|æ¦æ|Senritsu}} #{{Nihongo|"Solitude"|å­¤ç¬|Kodoku}} #{{Nihongo|"Resonance"|å±é³´|KyÅmei}} #{{Nihongo|"Anticipation"|æå¾|Kitai}} #{{Nihongo|"The Kira Special Investigation Unit"|ç¹æã­ã©ç­|TokusÅ Kira Han}} #{{Nihongo|"L's Theme B"|Lã®ãã¼ãB|Eru no TÄma BÄ«}} #{{Nihongo|"Hesitation"|é¡å·¡|Shunjun}} #{{Nihongo|"Pursuit"|è¿½è·¡|Tsuiseki}} #{{Nihongo|"L's Companions"|Lã®ä»²é|Eru no Nakama}} #{{Nihongo|"Special Investigation"|ç¹æ|TokusÅ}} #{{Nihongo|"Shinigami World"|æ­»ç¥ç|Shinigamikai}} #{{Nihongo|"Boredom"|éå±|Taikutsu}} #{{Nihongo|"Rem"|ã¬ã |Remu}} #"Death Note Theme" #"Kyrie" #"Domine Kira" #"Teleology of Death" #"Low of Solipsism" #"Requiem" #"Immanence" #"Dirge" #"Light Lights Up Light" #"Alert" #"The World (TV Size)" / [[Nightmare (Japanese band)|Nightmare]] #{{Nihongo|"Alumina (TV Size)"|ã¢ã«ããï½TVãµã¤ãºï½|Arumina ~Terebi Saizu~}} / [[Nightmare (Japanese band)|Nightmare]] ===''Death Note Original Soundtrack II''=== {{Infobox album | | Name = Death Note Original Soundtrack II | Type = Soundtrack | Artist = [[Yoshihisa Hirano]]
[[Hideki Taniuchi]] | Background = | Released = March 21, 2007 | Recorded = | Genre = [[Anime soundtrack]] | Length = 1 hour, 11 minutes | Label = [[Video and Audio Project|VAP]] | Producer = [[Kazunari Sengoku]]
Makoto Saito
[[Tokuwa Nagae]] | Reviews = | Chart position = | Last album = | This album = | Next album = }} The '''''Death Note Original Soundtrack II''''' for the [[anime]] adaptation was first released in Japan on March 21, 2007 and was published by [[Video and Audio Project|VAP]]. It contains music from the series, composed by [[Hideki Taniuchi]] and [[Yoshihisa Hirano]]. It also features the new opening and closing themes by [[Maximum the Hormone]] in the TV size format. Note that, while track 19 has the same title as track 14 on the first OST, they are in fact two different songs. Strangely, track 5 is identical to the first OST's track 28, although they have different titles. The first press' slipcover featured glow-in-the-dark artwork. ====Track listing==== #"Kyrie II" #"Semblance of Dualism" #"Low of Solipsism II" #"Death Note Theme (instrumental)" #"Tactics of the Absolute" #"Kyrie For Orchestra" #"Air" #"Light Lights up Light for piano" #{{Nihongo|"Black Light"|é»ãã©ã¤ã|Kuroi Raito}} #{{Nihongo|"L's Wall"|Lã®å£|Eru no Kabe}} #{{Nihongo|"Throb"|é¼å|KodÅ}} #{{Nihongo|"Anxiety"|ä¸å®|Fuan}} #{{Nihongo|"Anxious Feelings"|ç·å¼µæ|KinchÅ Kan}} #{{Nihongo|"Fire Origin"|ç«å£|Higuchi}} #{{Nihongo|"Horror B"|æ¦æB|Senritsu B}} #{{Nihongo|"The Yotsuba Murder Conference Room"|ã¨ããæ®ºãã®ä¼è­°å®¤|Yotsuba Koroshi no Kaigishitsu}} #{{Nihongo|"Hatred"|æã|Ikari}} #{{Nihongo|"Shinigami World B"|æ­»ç¥çB|Shinigamikai B}} #{{Nihongo|"L's Companions"|Lã®ä»²é|Eru no Nakama}} #{{Nihongo|"Misa's Theme A"|ããµã®ãã¼ãA|Misa no TÄma A}} #{{Nihongo|"Misa's Theme B"|ããµã®ãã¼ãB|Misa no TÄma B}} #{{Nihongo|"Intro"|ã¤ã³ãã­|Intoro}} #{{Nihongo|"Sakura TV"|ãµã¯ã©TV|Sakura TV}} #{{Nihongo|"Reasoning"|æ¨ç|Suiri}} #{{Nihongo|"Suspicious"|æªãã|Ayashige}} #{{Nihongo|"The Yotsuba Group"|ã¨ããã°ã«ã¼ã|Yotsuba GurÅ«pu}} #{{Nihongo|"Secret"|ç§å¯|Himitsu}} #{{Nihongo|"Clock Ticking"|æè¨ã®éã®é³|Tokei no Hari no Oto}} #"What's up, people?! (TV Size)" / [[Maximum the Hormone]] #{{Nihongo|"ZetsubÅ Billy (TV Size)"|çµ¶æããªã¼ï½TVãµã¤ãºï½|ZetsubÅ Birii ~Terebi Saizu~|lit."Despair Billy" ~TV Size~"}} / [[Maximum the Hormone]] ===''Death Note Original Soundtrack III''=== {{Infobox album | | Name = Death Note Original Soundtrack III | Type = Soundtrack | Artist = [[Yoshihisa Hirano]]
[[Hideki Taniuchi]] | Background = | Released = June 27, 2007 | Recorded = | Genre = [[Anime soundtrack]] | Length = 1 hour, 4 minutes | Label = [[Video and Audio Project|VAP]] | Producer = [[Kazunari Sengoku]]
Makoto Saito
[[Tokuwa Nagae]] | Reviews = | Chart position = | Last album = | This album = | Next album = }} '''''Death Note Original Soundtrack III''''', released on June 27, 2007 (Japan), is the third soundtrack album for the [[anime]] series ''[[Death Note]]''. The music was created by composer and musician [[Hideki Taniuchi]] and composer [[Yoshihisa Hirano]]. The tracks 1-21 were composed and arranged by [[Hideki Taniuchi]], while the tracks 22-28 were composed and arranged by [[Yoshihisa Hirano]]. The album features one track sung by [[Aya Hirano]], performing as her character [[Misa Amane]] from the series. Also appearing on this soundtrack is the ending theme ''Codaï½Death Note'', which can be heard at the end of the final episode of the [[anime]] as the credits are shown. The first press' slipcover featured glow-in-the-dark artwork. ====Track listing==== #"Death Image" #"L" #{{Nihongo|"L's Past"|Lã®éå»|L no Kako}} #{{Nihongo|"Near's Theme"|ãã¢ã®ãã¼ã|Nia no TÄma}} #{{Nihongo|"Mello"|ã¡ã­|Mero}} #{{Nihongo|"Mello 2"|ã¡ã­2|Mero 2}} #"Action" #{{Nihongo|"L's Ideology"|Lã®ææ³|L no ShisÅ}} #{{Nihongo|"Mello's Theme"|ã¡ã­ã®ãã¼ã|Mero no TÄma}} #{{Nihongo|"Confrontation"|å¯¾å³|Taiji}} #{{Nihongo|"Near"|ãã¢|Nia}} #{{Nihongo|"Misa"|ããµ|Misa}} #{{Nihongo|"Misa's Video"|ããµã®ãããª|Misa no Bideo}} #{{Nihongo|"Misa's Loneliness"|ããµã®å­¤ç¬|Misa no Kodoku}} #{{Nihongo|"Light's Return"|æ»ã£ãã©ã¤ã|Modotta Raito}} #{{Nihongo|"Suspicion"|çå¿|Gishin}} #{{Nihongo|"Tactics"|ç´°å·¥|Saiku}} #{{Nihongo|"Near 2"|ãã¢2|Nia 2}} #{{Nihongo|"Light's Performance"|ã©ã¤ãã®æ¼æ|Raito no Engi}} #{{Nihongo|"Misa's Feelings"|ããµã®æ°æã¡|Misa no Kimochi}} #{{Nihongo|"The Death of a Father"|ç¶ã®æ­»|Chichi no Shi}} #"Misa's Song" (Orchestra Version) (''Misa no Uta (orchestra version)'') #"Mikami Concertino" #"Trifling Stuff" #"Toward the Climax" #"Misa's Song (Piano Solo)" (''Misa no Uta (piano solo)'') #"Misa's Song" (''Misa no Uta'') #"Codaï½Death Note" ==Tributes== ===''Death Note Tribute''=== {{Infobox album | | Name = Death Note Tribute | Type = Soundtrack | Artist = Various Artists | Background = | Released = June 21, 2006 | Recorded = | Genre = [[Rock music|Rock]], [[Pop music|pop]] | Length = | Label = [[BMG Japan]] | Producer = | Reviews = | Chart position = | Last album = | This album = | Next album = }} '''''Death Note Tribute''''' is a tribute album dedicated to the [[live action]] movie for the ''[[Death Note (film)]]''. Published by [[BMG Japan]] on June 21, 2006 (Japan), it contains 15 tracks performed by various artists, such as [[Shikao Suga]] (feat. Amazons), [[M-Flo]], [[Buck-Tick]] and [[Aya Matsuura]]. The soundtrack came with a [[cosplay]] Death Note notebook. ====Track listing==== #{{Nihongo|"Secret Society"|ç§å¯çµç¤¾|Himitsu Kessha}} by [[Shikao Suga]] feat. Amazons #"37.0CÂ°" by [[Hitomi Yaida]] #"Hands" by [[M-Flo]] #"Real Days" by MCU #"Straight to Hell" by Char #"Diabolo -Lucifer-" by [[Buck-Tick]] #{{Nihongo|"Avant Garde"|ã¢ã´ã¡ã³ã®ã£ã«ã|Avangyarudo}} by Coil feat. [[KyÅko]] (æå­) #{{Nihongo|"Navigator of Darkness"|æéã®ããã²ã¤ã©|Kurayami no Nabigeira}} by [[Kreva (rapper)|Kreva]] #"Vendetta Code" by Aggressive Dogs / Death Note Allstars "D-Crew" #"Pursuit" by Aggressive Dogs / Death Note Allstars "N-Crew" #"Garden" by [[Kirito]] #"LâR" by [[Demon Kogure|DÄmon Kogure Kakka]] #{{Nihongo|"We are five samurai"|æãäºäººã®ä¾ãªã ï½We are five samuraiï½|Warera Gonin no Samurai Nari ~We are five samurai~}} by [[PE'Z]] #{{Nihongo|"Good Night"|ãªã¤ã¹ãããµã¤|Oyasuminasai}} by Kinmokusei #{{Nihongo|"My Wonderful Method"|ç§ã®ãããæ¹æ³|Watashi no Sugoi HÅhÅ}} by [[Aya Matsuura]] ===''The Songs for Death Note the movieï½the Last name Tributeï½''=== {{Infobox album | | Name = The Songs for Death Note the movieï½the Last name Tributeï½ | Type = Soundtrack | Artist = Various Artists | Background = | Released = December 20, 2006 | Recorded = | Genre = [[Rock music|Rock]], [[Pop music|pop]] | Length = | Label = [[Sony Music Distribution (Japan) Inc.]] | Producer = | Reviews = | Chart position = | Last album = | This album = | Next album = }} '''''The Songs for Death Note the movieï½the Last name Tribute''''' is a tribute album dedicated to the [[live action]] movie for the second ''[[Death Note (film)]]''. Published by [[Sony Music Distribution (Japan) Inc.]] on December 20, 2006 (Japan), it contains 14 tracks performed by various artist, such as [[Orange Range]], [[abingdon boys school]], [[High and Mighty Color]], [[Doping Panda]] and [[Galneryus]]. ====Track listing==== #"Hakai (Deathtroy)" by [[Hiroshi Kyono|Kyono]] and [[Sid Wilson|DJ Starscream]] #"Light Your Fire" by [[Rize (band)|Rize]] #{{Nihongo|"Chest"|ãã§ã¹ã|Chesuto}} by [[Orange Range]] #{{Nihongo|"Current Void This Word"|ï½æµãã»ç©ºèã»THIS WORDï½|~Nagareã»KÅ«kyoã»THIS WORD~}} (D.N.version) by [[Uverworld]] #"Fre@K $HoW" by [[abingdon boys school]] #"energy" by [[High and Mighty Color]] #"Miracle" by [[Doping Panda]] #"Ninja Night School" by Ultra Brain #"My Soul" by [[Miliyah Kato]] #{{Nihongo|"Zinnia"|ã¸ãã¢|Jinia}} by Hoi Festa #"Drive" by [[Hitomi Takahashi (singer)|Hitomi Takahashi]] #"Strange Days" by [[Masami Shiratama|Tama]] #"Serenade (D.N.mix)" by [[Galneryus]] #"The Distorted World 'Lead to Spin off L'" by Daita ==References== {{reflist}} {{Death Note}} [[Category:Anime soundtracks]] [[Category:Death Note]] [[Category:2006 soundtracks]] [[Category:2007 soundtracks]] [[ru:Ð¢ÐµÑÑÐ°Ð´Ñ ÑÐ¼ÐµÑÑÐ¸ (ÑÐ°ÑÐ½Ð´ÑÑÐµÐºÐ¸)]] [[uk:Death Note.
